notes.title: WEEK 1
notes.content:
📚 Week 1: Recovering a Sense of Safety

Focus:

Healing creative wounds + building trust in your inner artist by naming shame, silencing your critic, and showing up gently.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

🧠 Shame, fear, and criticism block creative flow
👹 Meet your inner critic (“The Censor”)
💛 Reconnect with safety, play, and self-trust

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

🧠 Creative Champions – list people who encouraged you
😔 Creative Monsters – list people who discouraged you; write an unsent letter
🪞 Affirmations + Censor Reframes – write 10 affirmations, then challenge the “blurts”
🌈 Imaginary Lives – list 5 dream lives
🎭 Inhabit 1 Imaginary Life – live one in a small way
🧸 Childhood Joy – favorite toy or creative memory
🖍️ Draw Your Inner Artist – as a child (stick figures welcome)
⏪ Time Travel – Positive memories of creative encouragement
⏩ Time Travel – Negative memories that still affect you
🧼 Support Inventory – who uplifts vs. drains your creativity

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ When has creativity felt safe or joyful?
🖊️ How does your environment affect creative risks?
🖊️ What’s the difference between your Censor + your true voice?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
🔁 Any synchronicities or emotional shifts?
💭 What resonated or felt hard?
💬 How are you feeling creatively?

notes.title: WEEK 2
notes.content:
📚 Week 2: Recovering a Sense of Identity

Focus:

Reclaiming your creative identity by releasing external expectations, setting boundaries, and rediscovering what you want to say, make, and explore.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

🧠 Noticing how others’ opinions shaped your self-concept
🚫 Saying no to people-pleasing and over-responsibility
🧍‍♀️ Stepping into authenticity and creative self-definition
📣 Beginning to hear your own voice again

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

🪩 Look for “Poisonous Playmates” – who distracts or drains you?
🚪 Practice setting small, safe boundaries
🧠 List things you used to enjoy that you’ve stopped doing
🖼️ Reclaim one forgotten interest or curiosity this week
🗣️ Write about something you’ve been afraid to say out loud
📚 Declutter your mental space: limit unhelpful input (news, gossip, social scrolling)
🎧 Pay attention to what energizes or exhausts your creative self
🧹 Identify places you’re over-helping or over-doing—then step back gently
🧍‍♀️ Ask: What do I want to create for me—not for approval?

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ Where have I lost pieces of my creative identity?
🖊️ What do I want more of in my creative life—and what do I need less of?
🖊️ How can I begin to trust my voice, my choices, and my pace?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
🔁 Any synchronicities, nudges, or shifts in perspective?
💭 What felt hard or sticky this week?
💬 What are you learning about your creative self?

notes.title: WEEK 3
notes.content:
📚 Week 3: Recovering a Sense of Power

Focus:

Reclaiming personal power by using emotions like anger, shame, and resistance as creative fuel rather than blocks—learning to trust what you feel and act on what you need.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

🔥 Anger is a map—pay attention to it
🙅‍♀️ Resistance signals growth, not failure
🧱 Shame and fear block expression
🧠 Truth-telling unlocks creative energy

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

🔥 Make an “Anger List” – what pissed you off recently? What’s it pointing to?
🙋‍♀️ Journal where you feel blocked and who/what might be contributing
🧠 Track resistance this week—when did it show up and why?
📜 Write about one shaming moment from your past—get it out
🎯 Do something you’ve been avoiding creatively (even one tiny step!)
🗣️ Say what you mean at least once this week—no sugarcoating
🧍‍♀️ Make a mini “I want” list—no edits, just honesty
💥 Identify where you’ve been hiding or holding back in your art
💌 Write a love letter to your boldest creative self
🌱 Reflect on the power of truth in your pages—what’s rising up?

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ What is my anger trying to tell me?
🖊️ Where do I feel creatively silenced—and why?
🖊️ What’s one brave step I can take toward expressing what you really want?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
🔁 Any resistance, breakthroughs, or strong feelings this week?
💭 What patterns or insights emerged?
💬 What’s feeling powerful or uncomfortable in your process?

notes.title: WEEK 4
notes.content:
📚 Week 4: Recovering a Sense of Integrity

Focus:

Realigning with your truth by clearing out distractions, becoming more honest with yourself, and listening deeply to what your inner artist actually needs—without numbing, avoiding, or overconsuming.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

🛑 Reading deprivation = clarity, not punishment
🧘‍♀️ Distraction is often disguised avoidance
🧠 Telling the truth (even to yourself) restores creative power
💡 Integrity is about alignment—doing what feels real and right

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

📵 Reading Deprivation – one week of no books, articles, or content consumption
📓 Use Morning Pages to process your reactions to less input
👀 Notice what you want to read when you can’t—what’s the craving covering up?
🖼️ Make space to hear your inner voice without noise
🧹 Declutter something physical—mirror the internal shift
🎧 Choose silence or music over media when possible
✍️ Freewrite a truth you’ve been avoiding
🚫 Track when/why you feel the urge to distract yourself
🔍 What don’t you want to see or hear right now? Be curious, not harsh
🗣️ Begin to say what you really mean (on paper or aloud)

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ What does “integrity” mean for me as a creative person?
🖊️ When do I feel most aligned, honest, or real?
🖊️ How do I avoid my truth—and what helps me return to it?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
📵 How did reading deprivation feel? What surfaced in the quiet?
💭 What did you discover about your habits, truth, or needs?
💬 Where are you craving more honesty or alignment?

notes.title: WEEK 5
notes.content:
📚 Week 5: Recovering a Sense of Possibility

Focus:

Challenging the limiting beliefs that keep you small and opening up to the idea that more is possible for you—more freedom, more creativity, more joy. This week is about saying yes to potential and no to self-doubt.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

🧠 Scarcity mindset keeps us stuck
🚪 Limiting beliefs can be rewritten
💡 Wanting more doesn’t make you selfish
🌱 Possibility grows from curiosity and action

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

💭 List your limiting beliefs (e.g., “I’m too late,” “Art doesn’t pay”)
🔁 Reframe those beliefs with new truths
🧠 Track how many times you say “I can’t” this week
🌟 Make a list of 10 creative wishes—be bold
🎯 Choose one and take one small step toward it
📸 Vision Board or Pinterest dream board session
✍️ Write a letter from your future, creatively fulfilled self
🛑 Notice where you self-sabotage or expect the worst
🧹 Clear something physical or digital to make space for “more”
🎧 Listen for moments of inspiration—follow where they lead

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ What do I want that I’ve been afraid to name?
🖊️ What beliefs about creativity or success need to be challenged?
🖊️ Where in my life is “possibility” trying to break through?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
💭 Did any old stories come up this week?
🌱 Where did you feel stretched, hopeful, or challenged?
💬 What possibility are you starting to believe in again?

notes.title: WEEK 6
notes.content:
📚 Week 6: Recovering a Sense of Abundance

Focus:

Shifting from scarcity to sufficiency by examining your beliefs around money, worth, and creative value. This week helps you notice where you limit yourself—and start inviting more support, joy, and overflow into your life.

✨ Core Chapter Themes

💸 Scarcity mindset restricts creativity
🧠 Money stories are often inherited and untrue
💛 Treating yourself with care builds belief
🎁 Abundance is a mindset, not a number

📋 Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

📜 Write your money story—what you were taught, what you believe
🧠 List your top 5 scarcity thoughts (then reframe them)
💰 Track how you spend and where you withhold (especially from yourself)
🎁 Buy yourself one small, meaningful creative treat
🧺 Declutter and donate something—create flow
📸 Create a “rich life” moodboard (what abundance feels like for you)
✍️ Journal: What would I create if you felt totally supported?
🔁 Practice 3 daily affirmations about money, joy, or ease
🛍️ Notice what feels luxurious and nourishing—not performative
🌷 Plan a low-cost Artist Date that feels decadent

✍️ Reflection Prompts

🖊️ Where am I still afraid to receive more?
🖊️ What do I truly believe I’m worthy of?
🖊️ How does abundance already exist in my life?

🌀 End of Week Check-In

📓 Did you do Morning Pages?
🎨 Did you go on an Artist Date?
💭 What scarcity patterns surfaced this week?
💛 Where did you allow more pleasure, ease, or enoughness?
💬 What does abundance look and feel like for you?
